title: Activate Modern Ruins
segmentation: So first I would like to thank future architecture, platform and all the participants.
It's greater opportunity to present our idea and we're very honored that we're being selected.
We identify ourselves even if we're all architects as an interdisciplinary team, because we approach the topic of modern ruins from a different perspective.
Yeah, alright, so the present proposal is a result of different interests and research focuses.

With span from urban exploration and digital tools to academic research, the project activate Morda Ruins is an ongoing investigation over modern ruins through photographic documentation, urban exploration, theoretical texts and has also been presented last year at the Venice Biennale in the Greek Pavilion.
Let's let's let's.
Start by what do we mean about what do we mean when we say modern ruins?
Although the notion of modern ruin is quite abstract, we define them as those buildings, infrastructures, and cities that have been abandoned through the process of urban decay.
Currently without use or function.
In most cases, these results from shifts in the social economic paradigm, such as the initialization or sudden natural disasters like a nuclear disaster, for example.
And the term has also been used to describe ghost towns such as sinus pain.
Krakow in Italy or pre pets in Ukraine, but also abandoned infrastructures like the Hellenikon Airport in Athens or the GMC factory in my house in France.
As well as other vacant spaces in general.
Around Europe.
During Renaissance ruin, his was perceived as a fragmented, scripted text of the ancient history.
While later in the.
18th century romanticism, steady sized ruin through the theories of sublime and picturesque.
However, it has only been a couple of decades since our perception of ruins change dramatically, and especially through the 21st century, along with historical developments in European cities.
Well, at first glance it is often associated with catastrofe.
Many scholars have discussed it in the context of heritage memory in Ostalgia.
And apparently.
Excuse me, modern ruins evoke a mixture of emotions, symbolisms and memories, along with a sense of melancholy for the loss of prosperity and security of the past years.
As Andreas Houston writes on his essay in Australia for ruins, we're nostalgic for the ruins of modernity because they still seem to hold the promise that has vanished from our own age.
The promise of an alternative future.
So.
Why do they matter today?
Way.
Identify 5 reasons.

The first adopts Bridgers notion for capital and support that modern ruins have persisted in there being long enough to carry social and cultural information embodied in their physical appearance and functional use.
Ruins also holds either explicitly or implicitly an architectural and aesthetic value generated by their fragmented and decayed appearance.
Furthermore, there embodied cultural capital manifests itself through the collective memory and last modern ruins have the latent potential of.
Formal or informal reuse at times of social economic upheaval such as global crisis and mass displacement of refugees.
So we can.
Firmly say that there is something modern about ruins.
Modern approaches regarding ruins include but not limit themselves to hype.
Fall high profile.
Every generation projects like the one that we see in brothers in London which is 1 card currently of the biggest regeneration projects in Europe.
The Occupy movements, like the refugee settlement in the former airport in the city of Athens and ruin porn.
Which describe a pop azatian of the ruin and decay through photographic online blogs.
Another trend that.
Has emerged during the last decades in relations or button buildings and infrastructure.
Is airborne exploration also known as airbags?
Urban exploration referred as well as infiltration, is the act of fendering and exploring space.
Debris's abandoned places, ruins or uninhabited sites.
The embodied practice of reclaiming urban space has a strong content in character.
Since the access to this size is usually under control or totally forbidden.
Urban explorers, either as individuals or as groups.
After selecting the site to visit, they infiltrate into the place.
As we have seen in the documentary, they document the side through photo photographs or sketches that document the whole procedure.
An finally published online, the collected material in order to establish an open dialogue with the broader community.

It could be said in this sense that urban exploration is a political act at announcement of the quality of contemporary urban environment that is characterized by spatial and social exclusions as well as of the way it is nowadays inhabited.
Drawing on our own experiences, urban explorers, architects and urbanists would develop the proposal.
Activate more.
In ruins.
In order to challenge the established presumptions over modern ruins and decay, as well as to inhabit numerous unused spaces in the city.
So the project speculates over the potential activation of modern ruins through the following steps.
Explore save crowd source, render and debate.
We will now present it step and its objectives and overall timeline as well as the actors involved in the process.
The first step.
To explore the ruin, we imagine this phase as an open call for evidence.
Many can invitation to urban explorers and researchers in various European city.
To submit material in a form of short text and companies by photos, collected objects, plans.
And visuals, panoramas, videos or scans of the various spaces.
The aim is to map a number of known and unknown cases, document their material and immaterial conditions and communicate these findings online.
This leads us to the second.
Step save the ruin after two months of receiving submissions at digital Archive of the collective material will be set up.
Unlike the findings of most researches that are rarely communicated and open to the public, our platform will disclose all information from the open call and make the documents publicly available.
This way will promote Open Access of information and at the same time we attempt to raise awareness about the urban phenomenon of declining urban environments.
The first step is all about the participation of individuals law.
Local communities experts and non experts in the process crowd sourced the ruin.
Will use social.
Media platforms to digitally expose their kind case studies and invite people to contribute with ideas and possible future scenarios.
Crowdsourcing is a specific sourcing model in which organisations use contributions from Internet users to obtain needed services or ideas, like in our case.
Our goal is to share the information and knowledge about these spaces and create a pool of visions concerning the activation of modern ruins.
We hope to get the public involved in the process.
Give a voice and provide agency to existing social practices.
The fourth step is about the engagement of architects and designers when it comes to render their ruin.
During this phase, architects will be invited to respond and deliver concrete suggestions on specific case studies based on the material produced during the previous steps.
We named this phase.
The architects echo as we would like.
To think of our discipline as a sounding board that receives ideas from the society and reflects them forward, adding its own layer of expertise.
The purpose is to ask architects to work with what the community wants and needs and how these activities or not.
Activities could be hosted in existing build forms.
The submission of design proposals by the invited architects is the final part in the knowledge production process.
By this point, we will have enough material to share in order to.
Debate the ruin as a final step, we propose the organization of an exhibition.
We present part of the digital archive and the architectural proposals submitted by the invited architects.
Next to that, we also propose their organization of a three days conference on modern Ruin.
Which will offer the opportunity to juxtapose an openly discuss the ideas generated from the crowd.
Sourcing next to those produced by the architects.
So what?
Why's this important?
We believe that the potential of our proposal lies in for Con.
Steps first in the use of digital media to open source information and involve the public and other stakeholders in the production of knowledge and acting in the city.
Crowd sourcing is the most vital part of this for it commissions and undefined an heterogeneous group of volunteers.

Secondly, the proposal is not in one of thing but rather a process which engages each time with different stakeholders and combines top down with bottom up processes, abolishing barriers between the architectural discipline.
And the public last but not least similar to Venturi, Scott Brown eyes and was learning from Las Vegas published in 1972.
We once again called for architects to be more receptive to the tastes and values of people.

We argue that there's a lot to learn from ruins, not as an opposition to the Avant garde architecture, but more as a realization that the future of architecture is more pragmatic, tactical, and minor.
It is more sustainable working with existing resources and infrastructure.

Rather than inventing or imposing new ones, it is more interested in having people involved in the process rather than projecting its own authority, and as such, we believe that the future of architecture lies in modesty, modesty in form, in scope, and in cost.
So just.
To summarize our proposal, activate modern ruins is about their identification, documentation, and communication of modern ruins through five steps explored.

Ruin followed by save the ruin, crowdsourced render, and finally divide the ruin throughout the whole process, where my aiming to explore and develop alternative scenarios for the future of European architecture and urban heritage.
Thank you.
